slide.content: Incubation period for COVID-19 is 2-14 days after exposure. 5 days are the average incubation period for most people. 80% of people will have mild symptoms. 20% will have difficulty breathing and may need hospitalization.
Ederly people or people with chronic medical conditions are more likely to have severe symptoms. However, even younger or healthier people may experience severe symptoms (7).
Chronic health condition that is considered to increase COVID severity
slide.list: Diabetes, High blood pressure, Chronic heart disease, Chronic lung disease
Fever +100.4 Fahrenheit, Dry cough, Tiredness,Aches and pains, Nasal congestion, Sore throat, Diarrhea

slide.content: Immediate medical attention when these signs and symptoms appear (6)
slide.list: Trouble breathing, Persistent pain or pressure in the chest, New confusion or inability to wake up, Bluish lips or face

slide.content: COVID-19 and Flu share a lot of the same features; however there are some key differences (8).
slide.list: Incubation: COVID-19 2-14 days vs Flu 2-4 days, Onset of symptoms: COVID-19 gradual vs Flu sudden, Children symptoms: COVID-19 less impactful vs Flu more impactful, Body chills and pain: COVID-19 less common vs Flu more common, Type of cough: COVID-19 dry cough vs Flu wet cough
